intro: Scrophularia badakhshanica, commonly known as the Badakhshan scrophularia, is a flowering plant species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with tubular shapes that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
